description: Construction of two industrial buildings with mezzanine floors to accommodate seven units (5,390sq.m) for flexible general industrial, light industrial and warehousing/distribution land uses (B1c, B2 and B8 Use Classes) with ancillary trade uses and associated vehicle parking and landscaping (following demolition of industrial buildings on site)
decision_conditions: Timing
The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| Approved Plans

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: C-164-TP-LP-01; LP-01-area; C-164-TP-03; C-164-TP-02; C-164-TP-05; C-164-TP-04; 718.19.02; C-164-TP-01; Planning Statement (prepared by Savills, dated December 2016); Design & Access Statement (prepared by Ian C King and Associates, dated 30 November 2016); Schedule of External Building Materials (prepared by Ian C King Associates, dated 30 November 2016); Transport Assessment (prepared by Paul Basham Associates, dated October 2016); Travel Plan (prepared by Paul Basham Associates, dated November 2016); Noise Screening Assessment (prepared by TRC dated November 2016); Air Quality Screening (prepared by TRC dated November 2016); Energy and Sustainability Statement V3 (prepared by Cudd Bentley dated 30/11/2016); Breeam Pre-Assessment V2 (prepared by Cudd Bentley dated 30/11/2016); Ecological Assessment (prepared by Ecology Solutions dated September 2016); 718.09.02 prepared by Terry Anderson Architects; Tree Survey and 718.TS.01 prepared by Terry Anderson Landscape Architects; Flood Risk Assessment Rev A (prepared by Bradbrook dated 30/11/16); Phase II Environmental Site Investigation Rev 01(prepared by Ramboll dated 06/05/2016); Additional Site Investigation and Detailed Quantitative Risk Assessment Rev 02 (prepared by Ramboll dated 22/09/2016).
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| Contaminated Remediation Scheme and Verification

Notwithstanding any approved documents, prior to the commencement of any works on site (except demolition and site clearance) the following shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation (de-contamination) scheme pursuant to part (a):

(b)	A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be compiled in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

REASON: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); and policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2016).
| Sustainable Urban Drainage Strategy - Detailed Design

Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved (excluding demolition and site clearance),  a detailed surface water drainage design (and relevant specifications), and updated Drainage Assessment Form shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority  (in consultation with the Lead Local Flood Authority) in accordance with the surface water management strategy in the Flood Risk Assessment  (prepared by Bradbrook and dated November 2016) and email received on 08/03/2017 from Bradbrook Consulting.  The approved drainage works shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved.

REASON: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Energy Strategy Condition

A.	Prior to the final completion of each non-residential unit, the approved industrial units shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 36.8% (equal to 36.07 tonnes CO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Assessment and Sustainability Statement V.3 prepared by Cudd Bentley Consulting Ltd in 30 November 2016:

i.	energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 4.29 tonnes CO2 equating to 4.38% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case

ii.	incorporation of solar PV technology with a total panel area of c. 532.8 m2 and capacity of at least 83.25Wp to supply at least 61.22MWh of electricity annually and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 31.78 tonnes CO2 equating to 32.42% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions reduction over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

B.	Within three-months of the first occupation of each non-residential unit, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and detailed BRUKL modelling output reports showing clearly the BER and TER from the "as built stage" following completion of the development to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

REASON: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013);  policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016); and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014).
| BREEAM/Sustainability

Each non-residential unit within the development should be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Very Good and make reasonable endeavours to achieve Excellent (based on the latest BREEAM NC Technical guidance).

i.	Within 3 months of completion of each non-residential unit, Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

ii.	Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of each non-residential unit, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good or higher standard shall be retained in working order for the lifetime of the development.

REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.2 and 7A of  the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012);and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2016).
| Ultra Low NOx Gas boilers dry NOx emission below 40 mg/kWh

Prior to the first occupation of each non-residential unit, the approved industrial units shall incorporate and maintain Ultra low-NOx boilers gas boiler(s) for the provision of the space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh in line with the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG  (April 2014).

REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies LV5.2 of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing Development Strategy 2026; policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan (2016); and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (April 2014).
| Sustainable Urban Drainage - Maintenance

Prior to occupation of the development, a maintenance plan should be submitted to demonstrate that the surface water drainage system will be suitably managed for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be maintained in accordance with these details in perpetuity.

REASON:              To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Green Travel Management Plan

Notwithstanding the approved documents the Travel Plan detailed in '40 Armstrong Way, Southall, Travel Plan' (dated November 2016 and prepared by Paul Basham Associates) shall be updated and submitted to the local planning authority for approval within three months of first occupation. The updated Travel Plan shall provide details of:
o	A Travel Plan Co-ordinator (TPC) employed prior to occupation and the contact details of the TPC will be provided to LB Ealing and WestTrans upon employment
o	A monitoring schedule agreed with the London Borough of Ealing with a baseline after 3months of occupation, then for years 1, 3 & 5.
o	Modal-share targets for staff travel by car, by cycle, by public transport and on foot.
o	 A commitment to the implementation of additional/remedial measures should they not meet agreed targets
o	Servicing and delivery arrangements and a management plan to demonstrate how designated parking areas would be controlled and enforced on site

REASON: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.
| External Surface Materials

The materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development indicated and specified on the Schedule of External Building Materials (prepared by Ian C King Associates, dated 30 November 2016) shall be in place prior to occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Ealing Local Variation to London Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| Vehicle Parking Arrangements

The parking arrangements for 53 vehicles (including four disabled parking bays) shown on drawing No. C-164-TP-01shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and to ensure that excessive parking is not provided, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Electric Vehicle Charging Points

At least fourteen parking spaces for electric vehicle charging points shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the approved development. At least nine of these parking spaces shall provide active charging points; and the other parking spaces shall be provided with passive charging provision.

REASON: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).
| Pedestrian Routes
The pedestrian routes shown on approved plan C-164-TP-01shall be marked out with pedestrian symbols prior to first occupation of the development.
REASON: In the interests of safe pedestrian access to and within the site, in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.10 of the London Plan (2016).
| Cycle Parking

Sheltered and secure cycle parking as indicated on approved plan C-164-TP-01 shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.

REASON: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.
| Vehicle Size Restriction
The maximum vehicle size to serve units 1-6 must not exceed a 10m rigid vehicle.
REASON: To ensure safe manoeuvrability within the site and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016).

| Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be installed and implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

REASON:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016)
| Landscaping Plan

The tree works and landscaping details hereby approved shall be implemented in accordance with the details shown on drawing No. 718.19.02. All tree protection methods shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.

The soft landscaping details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged, malformed or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size, species, quality and in the same positions within the next planting season. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed.

REASON: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which is of amenity and ecological value to the area and to ensure that the development is landscaped in the visual and ecological interests of the area in accordance with policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016).
| Permitted Development Rights

Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), the development shall only be used for B1c, B2 and B8 uses (including ancillary trade uses) and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the strategic industrial status of this Preferred Industrial Location, in accordance with policy 1.2(b) of the Ealing Core Strategy; and policy 2.17 of the London Plan (2016).
